content.description:
Ye Shall Know the Truth, and the Truth Shall Set You Free.

Don't land on the railing.... Honestly, don't fall. The cool kids campus the traverse.
content.location: If you can't find it, you weren't looking.

content.description: Get on the entry canopy and levitate up on ledges. By the time you are done, you will be one with the math department.
content.protection: An umbrella for floating back down.

content.description: This route is pretty even. Use the pipe and windowsills to work your way up. The crux is topping out.
content.location: Go past the dumpsters behind Loomis near the parking lot. In the left corner behind them, you will see a drainpipe - that is your route. Make sure you are a decently competent climber as the route is unprotected. Climb ideally at night to avoid campus security, and be on the lookout for them. To leave, either downclimb or go downstairs through a roof hatch or the staircase in the event the hatch is locked.

content.description: Start to the right of the green drain on mid body-height crimps or the right arete. Make a move to a okay right hand crimp, and shuffle your feet higher to then reach a bad, intermediary, left hand crimp-sloper. Make a long reach to the lip on good feet.
content.location:
In between

Feeding the Birds

and

Loomis Fights Back

, climb up and to the right.

content.description:
Get from the far window ledge out the door without touching the floor. The crux is the start to the first handrails. The swing around the shower wall is siiick.

Everything on the walls is on, but DON'T be a dingus and break things that can't take your weight, like the towel hook, shower curtain rod, paper towel dispenser, or toilet seat. PLEASE respect the building.
content.protection: If you get scared, you can ask your mom to come.
content.location:
1. Go into Slocum/South Hall. Be resentful that you don't live in a hotel.

2. Go to third floor southwest, aka old OESIC Hall.

3. Past the kitchen and lounge area, enter the single occupancy bathroom. Congratulations!

content.description: This is an adventure route. I don't really know where it goes..., but I hear from a reliable source that it goes. "It was a pretty fun and approachable route".
content.protection: A standard CC rack. Consult Weber liquor for conditions and the proper rack.
content.location: It is on the West side of the building. Follow the weakness up.

content.description: This is best done at night, don't use chalk. Eet eez Ã¼ber classique.
content.protection: 1 #21 C4 and an assortment of ballnuts.
content.location: It is on the west side of the McGregor building.

content.description: This is on the site of a historic bolt war. Don't climb this route, but if you do, cumbre o muerte!!!

Sit start on the right corner by a drain with a right hand crimp on the bulge on the third block from the base and your left hand on a sloper bulge one block down on the left side of the corner. Move up and left on a jug-crimp and high, right sidepull (right side of the corner) to gain an incut jug. Use crappy crimps and solid feet to traverse left, and stem onto the far left corner. With better feet, either pop to the window lip or inch up on okay holds.

Downclimb (if no pad) by stemming the corner.
content.location: It is on the Northwest corner of north face of Palmer Hall by a tree and a large, green transformer box.

content.description: On the backside of Palmer Hall by the HVAC unit, go up the window pillar, and dyno to the window ledge.
Fishbowl Traverse is best done at noon with a large crowd.

This is a fun, little problem in the lobby of Mathias Hall. Walk in from the south entrance, and the route can be seen straight ahead.

Start with both hands in the crack closest to the water fountain. Some safety precautions may be necessary (such as moving trashcans and fake trees that decorate the lobby). Without moving trashcans, this route easily bumps to V7, and the danger increases to possible death. Additional concerns are the RA on duty. Choose your time of ascent wisely.

The first ascent: Dane and Soren.
content.location: It is in Mathias Hall at Colorado College (in the lobby near the front desk).

content.description: Start low with your left hand on the left edge of the lower window and your right hand on a solid crimp. Slap up the left corner, and gain a high right hand jug. The crux move is laybacking the top corner of the lower window with a high left foot to bypass a blank section and get a bad crimp. Make a quick left hand pop to the windowsill, and top out to see the prize waiting at the top.
content.location:
It is one window to the left of the window that

Loomis Fights Back

ends on. Start on the right face of the windowsill.

climbs.name: El Pomar Corner
climbs.fa: I'm sure this was climbed years ago. It's too good not to have!

content.description: What a beautiful line! Follow the flared corner leading up to the entrance doors to the Sports Center. It climbs less as a dihedral and more as a technical face. Top out, and enjoy the leisurely descent. There is more potential development on the rest of the wall to the climber's right.
content.protection: Ha! Although pads could be used, the woodchips offer enough (potentially false) confidence to attempt without. A fellow climber fell at the (high) crux and walked away unscaled. Enjoy!
content.location: It is located beneath the south entrance to the El Pomar Sports Center. Begin in woodchips behind street lamp.

content.description: Facing the Slocum deck from the back, climb the third pillar from the left. This is done as a V3 using the corner blocks... it is considerably harder going up the "face" crimps. At the top, dyno to the deck's edge.
